questions.question: 1. In a basic counter, what should the values of input J and K be set to:

explanations.a: J and K are required to be set to 1 thereby converting the J-K flip-flops to T flip-flops

questions.question: 2. What is the Clk input point of the JK flip-flop, whose Q output is connected to QB, connected to :

answers.c: Q of other JK flip flop
answers.d: Q' of other JK flip flop

explanations.c: In general in an n-bit asynchronous basic binary counter, only the first flip flop's clk input is connected to Clock, clocks of all other flip flops are connected to Q of the previous flip flop

questions.question: 3. In a ring counter circuit, ORI:

answers.a: is initially set to low and remains low throughout the experiment
answers.b: is used as clear and preset

explanations.a: ORI is initially set to low and but its value changes to 1 after the first clock cycle
explanations.b: ORI is used as preset for the first flip flop and clear for the second and third flip flop

questions.question: 4. In a ring counter number of states is equal to:

answers.a: half of the no. of flip-flops used
answers.b: twice the no. of flip-flops used

explanations.c: Number of states = number of flip flops for a ring counter as at a given time only one flip flop can have the value 1

questions.question: 5. In a basic counter no. of flip-flops used is equal to:

answers.a: half of the no. of possible states

explanations.c: Number of possible states = 2^(number of flip flops) for a basic counter. So number of flip flops = log2(number of possible states)
